intro: Diplycosia brachyantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved diplycosia, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, with four petals and a tubular corolla, and are clustered in cymes. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas along riverbanks.
